meanings.definition: A pair of leaflets at the base of a compound leaf.
meanings.sent1: The jugums of the leaf help it capture sunlight efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She carefully examined the jugums of the plant to identify its species.
meanings.sent3: The jugums of the leaf danced in the gentle breeze, looking like a pair of tiny wings.
meanings.sent4: The jugums of the leaf were like two friends always sticking together.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the jugums made the leaf stand out in the forest.

meanings.definition: A pair of similar organs or structures joined together.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the jugums of the brain to understand its functions better.
meanings.sent2: The jugums of the flower petals were perfectly symmetrical.
meanings.sent3: The jugums of the butterfly's wings fluttered gracefully as it flew by.
meanings.sent4: The jugums of the bridge connected the two sides of the river seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The jugums of the puzzle pieces fit together perfectly, completing the picture.
